titleStmt.title: G. L. Frasher et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10506

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Louisa Ky, May 30th 1861
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky,

J. P. Israel and Nathan Adams were this day found guilty of Keeping a Tippling house. And We the subscribers, citizens of Lawrance Co. Ky. considering the pressure of the times would respectfully Solicit your Excellency to release our fellow citizens from the payment of the fine of the Same.
This 30th May 1861,

G L Frasher
Green McHenry
James I G Lee
Geo W Gallup
John, W, Keller
Floyd Roberts
Wm Troy
P, J, Livingston
S Short Judge of L C
Sol Willson
John M Foushee
John Morrow
Thomas H Stewart
J. F. Stewart Atty.
I H Sherf
T A Repass
G. S. Stewart
H meek
R H Meek
J Wilson
J Burk
A Burchett
Wm McKenzie
L T Moore
D L Burchett

William Troy
Noah Coffman
Wm H. Campbell
James Campbell
M B Loar

J A Hewlett

Michael Williams

J D Hewlett
A. J. Marcum J. P.

Lawrence J. P
$60 each } Tipling
J. P. Israel & Nathan Adams
Issd June 10 1861
